Desc: This API fetches a single ticket from your helpdesk.

Params.name: Param Name
Params.description: Description

Params.name: include see documentation
Params.description: Key that fetches secondary information related to the ticket. Values allowed are: contacts , products , assignee , departments , contract , isRead , team , and skills . Multiple values can be passed, with commas for separation.

Desc: This API lists a particular number of tickets, based on the limit specified.

Params.name: Param Name
Params.description: Description

Params.name: from
Params.description: Index number, starting from which the tickets must be fetched

Params.name: limit
Params.description: Number of tickets to fetch

Params.name: departmentIds see documentation
Params.description: Departments from which the tickets need to be queried. Note : For Predefined Views and All Department Views : You must specify the departmentId for which the tickets need to be fetched. Otherwise, it will fetch all tickets accessible across departments. For Single Department Custom View : You must specify the departmentId of the department for which the Custom View was created. The tickets will be fetched from that department.

Params.name: teamIds see documentation
Params.description: Key that filters tickets by Teams. Values allowed are Unassigned or a valid teamId . Multiple teamIds can be passed as comma-separated values.

Params.name: viewId see documentation
Params.description: ID of the view to apply while fetching the resources

Params.name: assignee
Params.description: assignee - Key that filters tickets by assignee. Values allowed are Unassigned or a valid assigneeId . Multiple assigneeIds can be passed as comma-separated values.

Params.name: channel
Params.description: Filter by channel through which the tickets originated. You can include multiple values by separating them with a comma

Params.name: status
Params.description: Filter by resolution status of the ticket. You can include multiple values by separating them with a comma

Params.name: sortBy
Params.description: Sort by a specific attribute: responseDueDate or customerResponseTime or createdTime . The default sorting order is ascending. A - prefix denotes descending order of sorting.

Params.name: receivedInDays
Params.description: Fetches recent tickets, based on customer response time . Values allowed are 15 , 30 , 90 .

Params.name: include see documentation
Params.description: Additional information related to the tickets. Values allowed are: contacts , products , departments , team , isRead and assignee . You can pass multiple values by separating them with commas in the API request.

Params.name: fields
Params.description: Key that returns the values of mentioned fields (both pre-defined and custom) in your portal. All field types except multi-text are supported. Standard, non-editable fields are supported too. These fields include: statusType , webUrl , layoutId . Maximum of 30 fields is supported as comma separated values.

Params.name: priority
Params.description: Key that filters tickets by priority. Multiple priority levels can be passed as comma-separated values.

Desc: This API gets the archived tickets list  in given department.

Params.name: Param Name
Params.description: Description

Params.name: from
Params.description: Index number, starting from which the tickets must be fetched

Params.name: limit
Params.description: Number of tickets to fetch

Params.name: departmentId see documentation
Params.description: ID of the department from which the tickets must be fetched

Params.name: viewType
Params.description: View Type - Supported Values 1 for Compact view , 2 for Classic view ,4 for Table View. If view type is not specified, Classic View will be the default view

Params.name: include see documentation
Params.description: Key that returns additional information related to a ticket. Values allowed are: contacts , products , departments , team , isRead and assignee . All six values can be passed by separating them with a comma in the API request.

Response Example:
{
  "data" : [ {
    "ticketNumber" : "836",
    "sentiment" : null,
    "subCategory" : null,
